newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Asian stocks end 1996 mixed or lower.
newsitem.headline: Asian stocks end 1996 mixed or lower.

text.p: Asian stocks ended the year mixed or lower on Tuesday in thin trading marked by profit-taking and window-dressing, dealers said.
Half-day sessions were held in Hong Kong and Singapore while many markets were closed for the holidays.
Hong Kong shares fell on profit-taking and a dip on Wall Street on Monday. They clawed part of the way back from sharp losses in early trading.

The Hang Seng Index finished 29.30 points lower at 13,451.45, after recovering from a 116-point drop at the open. Turnover was a healthy HK$5.46 billion, in line with Monday morning's HK$5.63 billion.
Normal trading will resume on January 2.
On Wall Street the Dow Jones Industrial Average dipped 11.54 points to 6,549.37, pushed down by program selling late in the session on Monday.
Singapore shares ended mixed on scattered year-end buying, dealers said.
"There was some window-dressing which pushed up certain stocks. But the volumes were so thin, there was hardly any activity," said a dealer with a local bank.
The Straits Times Industrials Index ended 1.66 points down at 2,216.79 while the SES All-share index was up 3.48 points at 536.12.
The Singapore market will be closed on Wednesday for the New Year and on Thursday for Singapore's general elections.
Shares opened lower in Delhi in thin early trade on profit-taking, brokers said. The bourse's benchmark index quoted 3.55 points lower at 698.60 after 30 minutes of trade.

In Bombay, blue chips started on a mixed note in the absence of any major market-moving factors, dealers said. ICICI rose 2.75 rupees to 63.50 rupees in volumes of 134,600 shares while SCICI was down 0.15 rupees to 27.0 with over 50,000 shares traded.
February Brent on SIMEX was offered at $23.80 per barrel with no bid, unchanged from midday levels. London rose 27 cents on Monday to close at $23.69.
Gold in Hong Kong was trading at US$369.20/70 vs a New York close of US$369.25/75.
At 0815 GMT the dollar was trading at 116.20/6.30 yen and 1.5549/56 marks.
